ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was
What is your overall assessment of this course
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course taught me to analyze films, their cultural context, and what they/their reception says about American society at the time. A good lens for looking at American history through multimedia.
how to connect films with history, learn more about history and culture through films

I watched a lot good movies that I have never watched before, and enjoyed analyzing their role in American History. I have learned how to write more efficiently and faster. I also saw the overall evolution of film through the years, and the impact it had on society.
I developed a greater appreciation for the portrayal of American history through movies and genuinely enjoyed watching all of the films on the syllabus.
Methods on how to assess a movie with a certain historical background.

This course has explored my vision of the relationship between the American history and the development of the American film. The book Movies and American Society which was recommended in the syllabus is very insightful and helps me to understand more about race, gender, class, politics and ethnicity around the film.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
strengths - very effective, good discussions
weaknesses - sometimes lectures or discussions just went too long and people lost engagement

strengths: the clips and films selected are really good and typical of certain eras. the teacher is really nice too. feedbacks are detailed and comprehensive.
weakness: when I prepared for my final essay, I did some research on certain films, and I found that many important themes had been mentioned in our discussion, but not as deep as what is elaborated in the papers. so I think it may be better if teacher can provide some ideas of the papers on certain themes when we have come to the point, rather than leave all of them for us to discuss.

The strength was that the content was very packed together, and there wasn't a moment where I was not learning something. Also, I liked the way of how we discuss the films, I could learn from peers as well as the teacher. I think the class can improve by having better equipment to play on that doesn't break down all the time.
The only way I believe the course could be improved is if the screenings took place in a more comfortable location, but that was not Professor Vielkind's fault!

Strengths: Rich readings; Multi-media; Free discussion;
Weakness: Maybe discussions can be done in small groups.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Great history course that introduced me to other forms of analysis.
yes, I would. I think this course is a good choice for students who want to learn more on film study, and it doesn't matter if he/she has no background on film study before.

yes, because it is a great way to learn American history in a visual way, where you can physically see people of certain era talking and moving. Through the movies, you can also derive their opinions from the way they present certain things.

Yes! If you are interested in the intersection of American history and film, this is the perfect class to take. The discussions were insightful, the movies were enjoyable, and Professor Vielkind is very nice and helpful.
Yes. I have watched a lot of high-quality movies and learn more about American history.
Yes, since this course is perfect for someone who is interested in film or American history.
Yes. This is because that this course helps students to build a basic, steady base for their further learning of American film history.

extras.title:
FILM S247 01/AMST S483 01/HIST S187 01
        Film, Video & American History
